meta.title: Complete Guide to Studying in France - Wendogo
meta.description: Complete guide to studying in France: Parcoursup, Campus France, admission procedures, universities. Everything you need to know to succeed in your study project.
meta.keywords: study in France, Campus France, Parcoursup, French university, international student, France admission, student visa
meta.ogTitle: Complete Guide to Studying in France - Wendogo
meta.ogDescription: Discover everything you need to know to study in France: procedures, steps, and expert advice.
meta.twitterTitle: Complete Guide to Studying in France

meta.schemaHeadline: Complete Guide to Studying in France
meta.schemaDescription: Complete guide to studying in France: Parcoursup, Campus France, admission procedures

hero.title: Complete Guide to Studying in France
hero.subtitle: Discover everything you need to know to succeed in your study project in France: procedures, steps, and expert advice.

overview.title: Why Study in France?
overview.subtitle: France is one of the most sought-after destinations for higher education.

excellence.title: Academic Excellence
excellence.description: World-renowned universities and internationally recognized degrees.

affordable.title: Affordable Cost
affordable.description: Among the lowest tuition fees in Europe at public universities.

culture.title: Cultural Richness
culture.description: Immersion in French culture, art, gastronomy, and history.

opportunities.title: Professional Opportunities
opportunities.description: Access to the European job market and numerous career opportunities.

overview.typesSubtitle: The French higher education system offers several types of institutions.

universities.title: Public Universities
universities.description: General education and research, moderate fees, national degrees.

grandes.title: Grandes Écoles
grandes.description: Excellence in education, selective admission, strong professional network.

specialized.title: Specialized Schools
specialized.description: Targeted professional training, connections with businesses.

overview.levelsSubtitle: The LMD system (Licence, Master, Doctorate) aligns with European standards.

licence.title: Licence (Bachelor's)
licence.description: General education over 3 years after high school diploma

master.title: Master's
master.description: Specialization over 2 years after the licence

doctorat.title: Doctorate (PhD)
doctorat.description: In-depth research over 3 years after the master's

overview.costsSubtitle: Estimated costs for studying in France

campusFrance.title: Campus France Procedure
campusFrance.subtitle: Campus France is the official platform for international students wishing to study in France.
campusFrance.concernedIntro: The Campus France procedure mainly concerns nationals of certain countries. Here is the complete list of concerned countries:

details.1: Create an account on Études en France

4.title: Pedagogical Interview
4.description: Interview with a Campus France advisor

campusFrance.documentsSubtitle: Complete list of documents to prepare for your Campus France file
campusFrance.feesSubtitle: Fees vary according to your country of residence
campusFrance.interviewSubtitle: Tips to succeed in your interview

interviewTips.1: Prepare your study project clearly and coherently
interviewTips.2: Be able to explain your background and motivations
interviewTips.5: Prepare questions about life in France

campusFrance.timelineSubtitle: Deadlines to respect for your procedure

tips.1: Start early: the procedure can take 3-6 months
tips.2: Choose programs consistent with your background
tips.3: Take care of your motivation letters (personalized)
tips.4: Prepare well for your pedagogical interview
tips.5: Keep copies of all your documents

parcoursup.title: Application via Parcoursup
parcoursup.subtitle: Parcoursup is the national platform for first-year admissions to higher education in France.

whoItems.1: French and foreign high school students studying in France
whoItems.2: Students seeking reorientation (already in higher education)

parcoursup.noteContent: International students residing abroad must generally go through Campus France, not Parcoursup.

cpge.title: CPGE (Preparatory Classes for Grandes Écoles)
cpge.description: Intensive preparation for grandes écoles entrance exams

dcg.title: DCG (Accounting and Management Diploma)
dcg.description: Specialized training in accounting and management

parcoursup.calendarSubtitle: Key dates of the procedure (indicative dates)
parcoursup.responsesSubtitle: Types of responses you may receive

accepted.title: Yes (accepted)
accepted.description: You can accept or refuse the proposal

waiting.title: Waiting
waiting.description: You remain on the waiting list

refused.title: No
refused.description: You are not accepted in this program

tips.2: Take care of your motivated training projects

parcoursup.complementaryContent: If you have not received any proposal or if you have refused all proposals, you can participate in the complementary phase starting at the end of June. New programs with available places are then offered.
parcoursup.forInternationalsSubtitle: Special cases according to your situation

parisSaclay.title: Paris-Saclay Admission Process
parisSaclay.subtitle: Paris-Saclay University has a specific admission procedure for its Master's programs.
parisSaclay.freeProcessDesc: Unlike other universities, the application to Paris-Saclay University is entirely free.

1.title: Application (March)
1.description: Via INCEPTION for specific M1 and M2

importantPoints.1: Do not apply via normal Campus France
importantPoints.2: Wait for acceptance before doing Campus France

cta.title: Ready to Make Your Study Project in France a Reality?
cta.subtitle: Our expert advisors support you personally in all your steps, from orientation to obtaining your visa.
